egg_color: Conspicuously pointed at one end, pale bluish green, and overlaid with a chalky coating
feeding_methods: swims slowly underwater, stalking fish around submerged vegetation, spear fish
prey: small- to medium-sized wetland fishes, with very small amounts of crustaceans and invertebrates

egg_color: Pale blue, fading slightly with age
nest_materials: sticks, lined with grass, reeds, moss, cupped
nest_microhabitat: mainly in trees, but will also nest on the ground, on bushes, in mangroves, and on structures such as duck blinds, channel markers, or artificial nest platforms
chick_description: bluish eyes open,  covered in pale gray down, able to vocalize
feeding_methods: grab smaller prey in their strong mandibles or use their dagger-like bills to impale larger fish, often shaking them to break or relax the sharp spines before gulping them down
prey: anything within striking distance, including fish, amphibians, reptiles, small mammals, insects, and other birds

nest_size: widths of ground nests (49.2 cm ± 5.9 SD) versus tree nests (42.5 cm ± 3.7 SD) were significantly different, as were nest depths (21.2 cm ± 8.7 SD and 10.5 cm ± 2.2 SD),
chick_description: white down, body dak gray, wram pale gray bill balck tip, change to yellow by 7 days.
feeding_methods: walking slowly, standing and waiting, second to SNEG in number of different foraging behaviors; kleptoparasitism from other species
foraging_depth: average 28 cm, GE will increase to 20 - 40 cm then decline
niche_description: depth more important than salinity, but will stay in open areas
prey: 98% fish, but opportunistic, size larger than other herons except for GBHE

chick_description: pinkish down, tubular to flattened bills, exceptionally cute
feeding_methods: tactolocation, head sweeping, will use grabbing or probing, and will run after abundant or active prey.
foraging_depth: <12 cm, max 20 cm based on leg length
niche_description: fresh to hypersaline, will feed at night; prefers coastal habitat

nest_microhabitat: head to chest height, never canopy
chick_description: white down, leg yellowish to grayish to black, pink mouth, pale gray iris
feeding_methods: broadest repertoire of foraging of any n. american heron.  Foot stirring, fly-stabbing, foot dragging, lots of habitats,
prey: worms, insects, crustaceans, fishes, anurans 75% fish, mosquitofish, needlefish

nest_materials: small twigs, woody vege, no green material, will nest in needlerush
nest_microhabitat: subcanopy, dense, well shaded 0.15 - 3.7 m above ground
chick_description: brownish reddish crown, bronish gray on back, white down abdoment,
feeding_methods: broad - striking, running, wing shading, foot raking,. Slow walking, usually solitary foraging or on edge of groups
foraging_depth: deeper than snowy, to belly deep, 18cm max

egg_color: creamy white to greenish, brown splotches
chick_description: dark downy, pink bills with dark markings,
branchling_period: 61 days mean, as early as 40 days
feeding_methods: walk and probe quickly, will use visual foraging, foot raking, pecking at surface,
niche_description: prefer freshwater in breeding season, will feed in coastal
prey: crustaceans, insects, small fishes, gambusia, crayfish, fiddler crabs

colony_habitat: historically cypress swamps, now many types including impoundments
chick_description: white, sparse down, eyes closed, 60 gm at hatching
feeding_methods: grope foraging, walking slowly with bill open in water, side to side motion, snap reflex, unitary foraging technique. Foot stirring and wing flicking
prey: fish>1 yr old, sunfishes, catfishes, killifishes, mollies,
